This month, police offered an $80,000 reward for information leading to the safe recovery of the children.

501 appeal: Woman to be deported after forging medical letters claiming her partner had cancer https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/501-appeal-woman-who-forged-medical-letters-claiming-her-partner-had-cancer-to-be-deported/QVE5B7HNA5E7JIJOJWEDUCXV3M/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/501-appeal-woman-who-forged-medical-letters-claiming-her-partner-had-cancer-to-be-deported/QVE5B7HNA5E7JIJOJWEDUCXV3M/ Tara ShaskeyBut two years later, the fraud was discovered and it all came crashing down. Ponsonby shooting: Police investigate whether revolver found in Lake Taupō was murder weapon https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/ponsonby-shooting-police-investigate-whether-revolvers-found-in-lake-taupo-were-murder-weapon/L6EQI5GKGFHQXAGRSIZHWHXHDE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/ponsonby-shooting-police-investigate-whether-revolvers-found-in-lake-taupo-were-murder-weapon/L6EQI5GKGFHQXAGRSIZHWHXHDE/ George Block, Jared SavageThey are cut-down Alfa Carbines, which have fast become the favoured gun for gang members. Sat, 15 Jun 2024 17:00:00 +0000 Hone Kay-Selwyn, who opened fire on Ponsonby Rd on May 5, 2024 killing Robert Sidney Horne, poses with a pistol and a wad of cash. Police have now found two pistols they believe could have been used in the killing in Lake Taupo. Photo / Supplied
